meanings.definition: A type of scale insect that feeds on plants.
meanings.sent1: The coccids were damaging the crops by sucking sap from the plants.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use pesticides to control coccids and protect their crops.
meanings.sent3: The coccids seemed to be having a feast on the garden plants, much to the dismay of the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The coccids spread across the field like tiny, destructive invaders.
meanings.sent5: The coccids left a trail of devastation in their wake, turning the once lush garden into a barren land.

meanings.definition: The plural form of coccid, referring to multiple individuals of the insect species.
meanings.sent1: We observed a group of coccids clustered on the underside of the leaves.
meanings.sent2: The coccids had multiplied rapidly, posing a threat to the entire garden.
meanings.sent3: The coccids gathered together, almost like a tiny insect convention.
meanings.sent4: The coccids covered the plant like a living blanket, slowly draining its life.
meanings.sent5: The coccids swarmed over the garden, turning it into a bustling insect metropolis.
